oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Persistence of bovine herpesvirus-1-specific antibodies in cattle after intranasal vaccination with a live virus vaccine
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Van der Poel, W. H. M.
Kramps, J. A.
Quak, J.
Brand, A.
Van Oirschot, J. T.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: bovine herpesvirus-1
antibodies
vaccination
seronegative
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: To study the development and persistence of circulating antibodies directed against bovine herpesvirus-1 (BHV-1) induced by vaccination, approximately 80 per cent of the seronegative cows in four partly seronegative dairy herds were vaccinated once with a temperature-sensitive live virus vaccine. Full article published in Veterinary Record (1995) 137, 347-348
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1995; 173
